channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: John Beam, Football Coach Who Was Focus of Netflix’s ‘Last Chance U,’ Dies After Being Shot
item.description: An arrest was made in the shooting of the coaching fixture John Beam, who died from his injuries in the shooting at Laney College in Oakland, Calif., ...

item.title: A Reopened Government Hasn’t Ended Delays to Economic Data
item.description: Jobs and inflation data will be released late and with caveats, complicating the Federal Reserve’s interest rate deliberations.

item.title: The Strategic Uncoupling of Zohran Mamdani and Brad Lander
item.description: Mr. Lander, the New York City comptroller, campaigned with Mr. Mamdani and once hoped to join him in City Hall. Now he is eyeing a congressional seat.

item.title: Judge to Approve Purdue Pharma Bankruptcy, Releasing Billions for Opioid Plaintiffs
item.description: Under the plan, the company will dissolve and its owners, members of the Sackler family, will pay as much as $7 billion of their personal fortune to s...

item.title: Scientists pull ancient RNA from a woolly mammoth's body
item.description: Scientists have extracted the oldest RNA molecules out of a woolly mammoth, gaining a snapshot into the processes at work in the extinct mammal's body...

item.title: Judge says he'll approve opioid settlement with OxyContin maker Purdue and Sackler family
item.description: A federal bankruptcy court judge said he will approve OxyContin-maker Purdue Pharma's latest deal to settle thousands of lawsuits over the toll of opi...

item.title: Seizures, broken spines and vomiting: Scientific testing that helped facilitate D-Day
item.description: Biomedical engineer Rachel Lance says British scientists submitted themselves to experiments that would be considered unethical today. Her book is Cha...

item.title: In Kansas and elsewhere, some state lawmakers are skeptical of the redistricting rush
item.description: Kansas Republican leaders couldn't rally enough support this fall for a special session on redistricting. It's just one example of lawmakers pushing b...

item.title: A storm devastated Alaska Native villages. Now their public media lost funding
item.description: A public TV and radio station in Western Alaska serves dozens of villages damaged by Typhoon Halong. But with federal funding eliminated, KYUK faces s...

item.title: Trump Plan Could Limit Green Cards for Immigrants From Travel Ban Countries
item.description: The policy change is a major expansion of the administration’s push to crack down on immigration from countries that it says lack sufficient screening...

item.title: Indigenous People Take the Stage at COP30 Climate Talks in Belém, Brazil
item.description: This summit is unlike any of its predecessors in at least one significant way: The Indigenous presence is palpable and strong.

item.title: Zelensky Ousted a Heavyweight Mayor. Was It a Power Grab?
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky removed Odesa’s mayor, raising fears he might be using his wartime powers to tighten control over opposition-run cities.

item.title: Israeli Settler Attack During West Bank Olive Harvest Leads to Death of a Boy
item.description: Palestinians see the violence, and its tolerance by right-wing Israeli officialdom, as part of a broader campaign to harass them and make life so unbe...

item.title: At U.N. Security Council, Russia Counters Trump Gaza Plan With Its Own
item.description: The Trump administration wants the Security Council to adopt a resolution that has the 20-point U.S. plan annexed, effectively making it international...

item.title: Stock Market Rally Is Dented as Signs of Worry Emerge
item.description: Choppy trading shows how investors are balancing a “fear of missing out at the same time as real fear.”
